column4: Are there *any* tools that make working with the command line or filesystem more "friendly"?
I don't say, yet more *powerful* tools.
what type of work with the filesystem?
I am not sure how screen makes things easier. It is very useful though
I would like to add and make use of metadata.
never used it, but this might help. http://www.midnight-commander.org/
ok
I hope it comes clear, the connection between file metadata and command line friendliness. I might tag several files 'foo', then supply '-tag=foo' instead of a shell path with wildcards.
I have never worked with file metadata
part of the issue is everyone has come up with a system of adding metadata
Well, aside from the native metadata -- mtime and so forth -- I have seen nothing.
exactly
are you using a special filesystem that has support for metadata?
I'm not.
then how does it work? I did not think extx did that
I'm looking for solutions. I don't know what they are.
in that case step back. I believe you first need to use a different fs that supports metadata

There are dozens, maybe hundreds of shell commands. I limit this to stuff intended for the command line that does a certain thing and exits; I draw the line at plain invocation of a interactive application.
what are you talking about?
Um, what kind of explanation should I make? I just said that there are a large number of shell commands.
Where did I get confusing?
